author: cashheaven
root_title: Battle Mages Secret: Another victim of Counterspell amplified
body:
![BATTLE MAGE SECRETS COUNTER SPELL](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/splinterlands/23wgRqiUR5EQwGZgLfR9ss36QcdXqDj3aDRrzd748pikLs7rpPgppEA3syCkyRJSQGYQg.png) This week, I'm sharing my game in Counter Spell ruleset using Grandmaster Rathe. ![COUNTER SPELL weekly challenge](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/cashheaven/23wCdNbYBGr2iy2idPWVJxneb2SoAUrd3asAhCpvw4HBJ2ZsiiMGC36xZz5mimnZNRfD2.png) You can check out this [BATTLE MAGE SECRETS Weekly Challenge link](https://peakd.com/hive-13323/@splinterlands/battle-mage-secrets-weekly-challenge-s8xdrm) if you also want to participate. ---
**Ruleset:** *Equal Opportunity* *Counterspell* *Close Range* **Mana Cap:** *41* **Elements:** *Fire,Water,Life,Death*
![Game Modifications](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/cashheaven/EoEo67tiYZP76DQp4J53pzqAwvLtMQ1rnHuxpfhJRHMyXo5qqXRkFdP76YAtwTQRRZh.png)
This is an [Equal Opportunity](https://splintercards.com/rulesets.php?rs=8) ruleset game so All Monsters have the Opportunity ability. Speed and HP is the trick here: higher speed will let you target enemy's low HP monster first, opening the way for your slower monsters to deal damage to higher HP enemy monsters. Keep lower HP monsters in front.
![Equal Opportunity](https://splintercards.com/media/ruleset/equal-opportunity.png)
This is a [Counterspell](https://support.splinterlands.com/hc/en-us/articles/9123215350548-List-of-Splinterlands-Rulesets) ruleset game so All units receive the magic reflect ability at the start of the battle. Enemy units that attack with magic receive damage back. The amplify ability increases damage.
![Counterspell](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/964707845981478952/1057716171346038876/img_combat-rule_counterspell_150.png)
This is a [Close Range](https://splintercards.com/rulesets.php?rs=5) ruleset game so Ranged attacks may be used in the first position in battles. You can use high HP or high speed Ranged monsters at position 2 (or even at position 1 if it has Heal). Choose summoners that give a bonus to Ranged attack or to speed and then choose high damage Ranged attack monsters. Beware of the possibility that your opponent might pick Lir Deepswimmer or Ilthain as summoner or monsters with Return Fire. High HP and Heal is the way to go in this ruleset.
![Close Range](https://splintercards.com/media/ruleset/close-range.png)
--- ![Let the battle begin!](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/cashheaven/23vsDwStg7yDwQ3EKExfh8EwkFUtnbNT3CYXnph2JaRWAAmEbELes9csjrXC4PgC6HzWm.png) You may also [watch battle here](https://splinterlands.com/?p=battle&id=sl_d453770c3fe28c55e6501914b25ccbbb). ---
Summoner: **Grandmaster Rathe** Abilities: All friendly monsters gain +1 armor All friendly monsters gain [Void Armor](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=49) ability All friendly monsters gain [Amplify](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=87) ability
![Grandmaster Rathe](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/chaos/Grandmaster%20Rathe_lv3.png) ---
Pos 1 Monster: **Pelacor Conjurer** Abilities: [Flying](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=2) - Has an increased chance of evading Melee or Ranged attacks from Monsters who do not have the Flying ability +25% chance of evading. [Magic Reflect](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=16) - When hit with Magic damage, does reduced Magic damage back to the attacker Deals damage equivalent to the attacker's damage divided by 2, rounded up. The damage is reflected even if the attacker does not hit [Divine Shield](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=18) - The first time the Monster takes damage it is ignored. Summoner Lorna Shine (Dice, Life, Rare) give Divine Shield to all friendly monsters at the start of the battle. Good in low mana battles. Divine shield doesn't protect against poison, damage is taken and Divine shield is not removed
![Pelacor Conjurer](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/reward/Pelacor%20Conjurer_lv8.png) ---
Pos 2 Monster: **Djinn Renova** Abilities: [Strengthen](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=29) - All friendly Monsters have increased Health [Triage](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=26) - Heals the friendly back-line Monster that has taken the most damage Heal is max health divided by 3, rounded down. Minimum is 2.
![Djinn Renova](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/reward/Djinn%20Renova_lv5.png) ---
Pos 3 Monster: **Venari Marksrat** Abilities: [Martyr](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=99) - When this Monster dies, adjacent Monsters get +1 to all stats [Snare](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=35) - When attacking enemies with Flying, removes the Flying ability and cannot miss.
![Venari Marksrat](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/soulbound/Venari%20Marksrat_lv5_gold.png) ---
Pos 4 Monster: **Jared Scar** Abilities: [Bloodlust](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=86) - Every time it defeats an opponent, it gets +1 to all stats In the Reverse Speed ruleset, -1 to Speed [True Strike](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=56) - This monster's attacks cannot miss Blind doen't affect monster with True Strike [Piercing](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=15) - If Melee or Ranged attack damage is in excess of the target's Armor, the remainder will damage the target's Health
![Jared Scar](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/reward/Jared%20Scar_lv3.png) ---
Pos 5 Monster: **Adelade Brightwing** Abilities: [Flying](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=2) - Has an increased chance of evading Melee or Ranged attacks from Monsters who do not have the Flying ability +25% chance of evading. [Repair](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=24) - Restores some armor to the friendly Monster whose armor has taken the most damage [Resurrect](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=13) - When a friendly Monster dies it is brought back to life with 1 Health. This ability can only trigger once per battle [Immunity](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=52) - This monster is immune to negative status effects
![Adelade Brightwing](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/chaos/Adelade%20Brightwing_lv3.png) ---
Pos 6 Monster: **Prismologist** Abilities: [Blast](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=22) - Does additional damage to Monsters adjacent to the target Monster Additional damage is equivalent to main damage divided by 2, rounded up [Forcefield](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=88) - This Monster takes only 1 damage from attacks with power 5+
![Prismologist](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/chaos/Prismologist_lv5_gold.png) --- Now that Rebellion edition is here, do you think there's a stronger line up in this Game Modification? Comment down below. You may also [watch battle here](https://splinterlands.com/?p=battle&id=sl_d453770c3fe28c55e6501914b25ccbbb). --- Hope you learned something from my game and how I came up with this lineup. What would you have done differently given the same ruleset, mana cap and active elements? Let us know by dropping a comment. --- Want to play Splinterlands with me? root_title: Battle Mage Secrets: Counterspell amplified by Grandmaster Rathe
body:
![BATTLE MAGE SECRETS COUNTER SPELL](https://images.hive.blog/0x0/https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/splinterlands/23wgRqiUR5EQwGZgLfR9ss36QcdXqDj3aDRrzd748pikLs7rpPgppEA3syCkyRJSQGYQg.png) This week, I'm sharing my game in Counter Spell ruleset using Grandmaster Rathe. ![COUNTER SPELL weekly challenge](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/cashheaven/23wCdNbYBGr2iy2idPWVJxneb2SoAUrd3asAhCpvw4HBJ2ZsiiMGC36xZz5mimnZNRfD2.png) You can check out this [BATTLE MAGE SECRETS Weekly Challenge link](https://peakd.com/hive-13323/@splinterlands/battle-mage-secrets-weekly-challenge-s8xdrm) if you also want to participate. ---
**Ruleset:** *Aim True* *Equal Opportunity* *Counter Spell* **Mana Cap:** *25* **Elements:** *Fire,Water,Earth,Life*
![Game Modifications](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/cashheaven/23vsBs1oGvc5ww3YYAQsJ6DnWXxrz68Ga3mGPhceZRGrochdyEz9b7gtBKLNpiN2Cnnfk.png)
This is an [Aim True](https://splintercards.com/rulesets.php?rs=1) ruleset game so Melee and Ranged attacks always hit their target. Blind, flying, dodge are useless. This Ruleset doesn't give Ranged monsters the ability to attack from the first position. Choose higher speed or higher health combined with high damage output. Return Fire ability is great in this ruleset.
![Aim True](https://splintercards.com/media/ruleset/aim-true.png)
This is an [Equal Opportunity](https://splintercards.com/rulesets.php?rs=8) ruleset game so All Monsters have the Opportunity ability. Speed and HP is the trick here: higher speed will let you target enemy's low HP monster first, opening the way for your slower monsters to deal damage to higher HP enemy monsters. Keep lower HP monsters in front.
![Equal Opportunity](https://splintercards.com/media/ruleset/equal-opportunity.png)
This is a [Counterspell](https://support.splinterlands.com/hc/en-us/articles/9123215350548-List-of-Splinterlands-Rulesets) ruleset game so All units receive the magic reflect ability at the start of the battle. Enemy units that attack with magic receive damage back.
![Counterspell](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/964707845981478952/1057716171346038876/img_combat-rule_counterspell_150.png)
--- ![Let the battle begin!](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/cashheaven/23uFH1khpg5nT8E2QFpqfS1sXCmSJJDBQ5D1cALKLyrNXqdD8U45n8MxXzAKG3Ya7UVQS.png) You may also [watch battle here](https://splinterlands.com/?p=battle&id=sl_60cd17bbf6de6487ec1eaa59b4a74620). ---
Summoner: **Grandmaster Rathe** Abilities: All friendly monsters gain +1 armor All friendly monsters gain [Void Armor](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=49) ability All friendly monsters gain [Amplify](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=87) ability
![Grandmaster Rathe](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/chaos/Grandmaster%20Rathe_lv4.png) ---
Pos 1 Monster: **Blinding Reflector** Abilities: [Magic Reflect](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=16) - When hit with Magic damage, does reduced Magic damage back to the attacker Deals damage equivalent to the attacker's damage divided by 2, rounded up. The damage is reflected even if the attacker does not hit [Blind](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=65) - All enemy Melee & Ranged attacks have an increased +15% chance of missing their target.
![Blinding Reflector](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/chaos/Blinding%20Reflector_lv10.png) ---
Pos 2 Monster: **Chaos Knight** Abilities: [Shield](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=5) - Reduced damage from Melee and Ranged attacks. Attack damage gets halved (rounded up), except attack 1 which deals 0 damage Reduces the Thorns damage to 1 Cancel Redemption damage [Giant Killer](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=92) - Does double damage against targets that cost 10 or more mana [Inspire](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=11) - Gives all friendly Monsters +1 Melee attack.
![Chaos Knight](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/chaos/Chaos%20Knight_lv10.png) ---
Pos 3 Monster: **Soul Fiend** Abilities: [Swiftness](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=23) - It gives all friendly Monsters +1 increased Speed.
![Soul Fiend](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/chaos/Soul%20Fiend_lv4.png) ---
Pos 4 Monster: **Vulguine** Abilities: [Scavenger](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=37) - Gains 1 max health each time any monster dies [Dodge](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=34) - Has an increased chance of evading Melee or Ranged attacks. +25% Dodge vs melee/ranged [Enrage](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=14) - Has increased Melee attack and Speed when damaged. Multiplier x1.5 rounded up
![Vulguine](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/reward/Vulguine_lv8.png) ---
Pos 5 Monster: **Jared Scar** Abilities: [Bloodlust](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=86) - Every time it defeats an opponent, it gets +1 to all stats In the Reverse Speed ruleset, -1 to Speed [True Strike](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=56) - This monster's attacks cannot miss Blind doen't affect monster with True Strike [Piercing](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=15) - If Melee or Ranged attack damage is in excess of the target's Armor, the remainder will damage the target's Health
![Jared Scar](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/reward/Jared%20Scar_lv4.png) ---
Pos 6 Monster: **Gargoya Scrapper** Abilities: [Void](https://splintercards.com/abilities.php?ab=12) - Reduced damage from Magic attacks Attack damage gets halved (rounded up), except attack 1 which deals 0 damage
![Gargoya Scrapper](https://d36mxiodymuqjm.cloudfront.net/cards_by_level/chaos/Gargoya%20Scrapper_lv10.png) --- Now that Rebellion edition is here, do you think there's a stronger line up in this Game Modification? Comment down below. You may also [watch battle here](https://splinterlands.com/?p=battle&id=sl_60cd17bbf6de6487ec1eaa59b4a74620). --- Hope you learned something from my game and how I came up with this lineup. What would you have done differently given the same ruleset, mana cap and active elements? Let us know by dropping a comment. --- Want to play Splinterlands with me? [Play with me](https://splinterlands.com?ref=cashheaven) Make passive income by renting out your card collection in [peakmonsters](peakmonsters.com) Earn on your blogs. Blog with us here in [Hive](https://peakd.com/register?ref=cashheaven) Earn passive income by sharing your internet bandwidth with [Honeygain](https://r.honeygain.me/JONAS2EC92) If you are looking for a charity to donate to, please consider [Food for Hungry Minds](https://foodforhungryminds.org/donate/). ###### Card images are owned and open-sourced by Splinterlands.io Follow @advertisingbot2, an account that gives you mini-jobs and campaigns Please follow @awuahbenjamin as he is a helper of people in need and a hive promoter @awuahbenjamin lives in ghana and is engaged in the Hiveghana community.
